title: Christian Eriksen told to give up on Real Madrid dream because he's 'not good enough'
text:

Jamie Carragher has urged Tottenham midfielder Christian Eriksen to forget about a move to Real Madrid following another subdued performance from the Dane during Spurs' 2-1 loss to Liverpool .

Eriksen expressed his desire for a "new challenge" during the summer but ended up staying at the club, although his contract is due to expire next summer.

The 27-year-old has scored just one goal and created one assist in nine Premier League appearances so far this season, and following a largely anonymous display against the Reds Sky Sports pundit Carragher argued that Eriksen is not good enough to justify a move to Madrid.

(Image: PETER POWELL/EPA-EFE/REX)

"Eriksen for me is a really good player for Tottenham , but he keeps getting talked about as this player who could play for Real Madrid. He's not good enough," said Carragher.

"If he's that good, he's got a year to go in his contract, you'd pay money for him. People keep saying maybe on a free transfer... you'd have anyone on a free transfer.

"This summer he wanted to go, he made it known, he said it publicly, and no one came in for him.

"I think Eriksen has been fantastic for Spurs but he's not better than Spurs. He might go to PSG, he might go to another club, but he won't make any of them better."

His fellow pundit Gary Neville, however, was not of the same opinion, and argued that his former side Manchester United would take Eriksen.

(Image: Action Images via Reuters)

"I think he could play in the top clubs, because he'd be around really good players," Neville added. "He's proved he's a top player and he works hard. This is not a reflection of what we've seen for four years.

"I think United would pay (for Eriksen). United are struggling to get players in for less than £50m or £60m and I think they'd pay that for him."
description: The want-away Tottenham midfielder was ineffective in his side's 2-1 defeat to Liverpool amid reports linking him with a move to the Spanish giants
